page.title: 11LOCAL AGRICULTURE
page.content: The countryside consists of open fields, wooded areas, and a steep escarpment. The soil ranges from blowing sand to alluvial gravel, medium loam, sandy and clay silt to heavy Londom clay. Most farmers are tenants, a few own whole or part of their farms. The landowners are Christchurch and St. John's Colleges, the Church Commission and Broadhurst and Buchan Estates. The crops are barley, wheat, oil seed rape and agricultural peas. The grassland is used for pasture, silage and hay. The animals are beef cattle, sheep and pigs. There are 70 acres of horticulture:_ "Pick your own fruit and vegetables". The farms are worked mainly by the farmer and his family using their own tractors and farm machinery.
